intro: Sideroxylon dentatum, commonly known as the African ironwood tree, is a member of the Sapotaceae family. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 20 meters tall, characterized by its dense, dark hardwood and thick, waxy leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by oval, woody fruits containing one or two seeds. Its bark is thick and fissured, and it is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is native to tropical Africa and is valued for its durable wood used in construction and furniture.
